title: CalPlant Bondholders at Odds as Fiberboard Maker Enters Bankruptcy
sub_head: The California company gets approval to immediately tap more than $7 million in chapter 11 financing at its debut hearing
body:
Bankrupt fiberboard manufacturer CalPlant I LLC won interim court approval for a financing deal, as junior and senior bondholders previewed possible conflicts between them over restructuring terms.
The Willows, Calif.-based business made its debut in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Wilmington, Del., on Thursday to seek approval of $30.1 million in financing, including more than $7 million immediately, to help it reorganize.
